summary: This is a federal indictment against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct required inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. The indictment details how their dereliction of duty allowed Jeffrey Epstein to commit suicide in his cell without being observed.

connections.description: Indicted together for conspiring to defraud the United States by falsifying count slips and failing to perform inmate counts and rounds.
Noel was the correctional officer responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU on the night of his suicide.
Thomas was one of the officers who responded to Epstein's prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and was on duty the night of his suicide.

events.title: Failure to Perform Counts and Rounds
events.description: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas repeatedly failed to conduct mandated inmate counts and 30-minute rounds in the SHU, instead falsifying records.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Tova Noel and Michael Thomas discovered Jeffrey Epstein's body in his cell; he had committed suicide by hanging overnight while unobserved.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU), ninth floor of MCC
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are charged with conspiracy and making false records for failing to conduct inmate counts and rounds at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019.
No institutional counts or 30-minute rounds were conducted in the SHU from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 to 6:30 a.m. on August 10, despite falsified paperwork indicating they were completed.
Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his cell during this period of non-observation, having been left without a cellmate contrary to psychological staff directives.
Video surveillance confirmed the officers did not perform their duties and instead slept, browsed the internet, and moved around the common area.
The indictment details five specific false count slips for the 4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m. institutional counts that were submitted to the MCC.
